result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas S Payne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.

Pay ZCI fees. Complete a mental health assessment and follow through with all recommendations. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement. Firearm warning given. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas S Payne

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Nicholas S Payne in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Plea to count 1.
Rights Given
P- NC
BTC: Finding of guilt as to count 1. 
Sentence withheld, 1 year probation to run concurrent to any other term of probation. 
$100 fine + cc.
Provide DNA sample + pay fee.
Pay ZCI fees.
Mental health assessment and follow through with all recommendations.
Obtain GED.
FAW
VOTE
Plea hearing on August 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
BOND AMENDED - DEFENDANT TO POST ADDITIONAL $300 CASH BY 5:00 P.M. TODAY OR REPORT TO RACINE COUNTY JAIL.
